docs.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to Macromolecules
docs.text: This chapter introduces the structure and function of biological macromolecules.

docs.title: Galactobiose Identification Question
docs.text:
Guide to Identifying the Chemical Structures of Macromolecules Carbohydrates (monosaccharides)
  • Should have about the same number of oxygens as carbons.
  • Look for hydroxyl groups (–OH) attached to the carbon atoms.
  • Carbonyl groups (C=O) are often present as well.
  • Look for the base unit of CH2O.
  • Larger carbohydrates will form hexagon or pentagon ring-like structures.

docs.title: Question
docs.text: Which one of the four main types of macromolecules is represented by the chemical structure of galactobiose shown above?

docs.title: Answers:
docs.text:
• A. Carbohydrates (monosaccharides) - Correct
  • B. Lipids (fatty acids) - Incorrect
  • C. Proteins (amino acids and dipeptides) - Incorrect
  • D. Nucleic acids (nucleobases) - Incorrect
